relation: There are parties about every weekend, but there are also a lot of great RSO's that you can join and have fun with. As well as little scheduled events throughout the year.
The Student Center always had good choices if you had prepaid money on your card, but the cafeteria was a good go to place as well. They had the basic staple items.
My dorm experience was okay but I enjoy living in my own apartment much more. It was nice to have neighbors that you see everyday though.
Classes aren't too hard, but some require a lot of work.
Always go to class! Social time is important but the classes will get you into the real world!
Great atmosphere and great people. There are many opportunities to network and meet new people. The learning environment is great.
pageTitle: University of Central Arkansas Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {292822=I feel safe on campus - good lighting and always someone outside. I think the police escort hours should go beyond 10:00 p.m., 364627=I feel 100% protected on this campus. The police close all the gates around 10:00 p.m. only allowing one or two entrances on campus. I see the police cars everywhere on campus either driving or walking and monitoring. There are also multiple emergency buttons around campus if you're in trouble and need immediate help., 399203=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 37629=the university of central arkansas is a community oriented school. this school has a 1:19 professor-student ratio, which allows for individual based learning in a higher education type learning environment. this school is great for those who like the pleasures of both a small town and a larger town., 355925=Food isn't awful on campus, but you will grow tired of it, especially in the cafeteria. The dorms all have kitchens so it wouldn't be too difficult to concoct a homemade meal occasionally.}

textAfterTable: Jelisa from Brinkley, AR 12/12/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 11 out of 12 people found this review useful. 2 of 97 Categories Comments Bang for the buck Tuition is not the best but they do offer a lot of scholarships, and the scholarships are increasing as tuition increases, but you have to keep up your grades in order to keep them. Am enjoying being here The students at the school are very friendly. The school has functions that give new students the chance to interact with other students and faculties so that their stay at the University is good. Am learning a lot This school has so much you can learn from. Every class I have taken I have learned something from it. The teachers are very passionate about the topic they are teaching and do A good job at it. Login to rate or flag the reviews
